intro: Anaphalis barnesii, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silvery, woolly leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically white to pale yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Anaphalis barnesii is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in semi-arid to desert conditions.
